702501f-a.title: Brooklyn: 9th Street (West) - Hamilton Avenue
702501f-a.text:
(1)
West 9th Street, west from Hamilton Avenue. The houses
on the south side of the street (left) were demolished later in
the year to make way for the Red Hook housing project sponsored
by the New York City Housing Authority.
June 9, 1938
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIOS
(2)
The same, at a later date, showing the housiug center
under construction.
April 9, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODU:TITIS

NO REPRODU:TITIS

702500f-b.title: Brooklyn: 9th Street (West) - Hamilton Avenue
702500f-b.text:
West 9th Street, east from and across Hamilton Avenue. The
Red Hook government houses are being built behind the fence on the
right.
View 1: April 9, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
2,3--
Buildings on the east side of Hamilton Avenue were torn down
to make way for the widening of the avenue and the construction
of Gowanus Parkway, a link in the Belt Parkway system.
Views 2,3: October 23, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
